introduction.p: Irrational numbers are harder to approximate if there is a radical in the denominator. So we remove those radicals by "rationalizing the denominator."

solution.p: We multiply the numerator and denominator by the denominator, \sqrt{3x}. \dfrac{1}{\sqrt{3x}} \cdot \alert{\dfrac{\sqrt{3x}}{\sqrt{3x}}} = \dfrac{\sqrt{3x}}{3x}

statement.p: Simplify the radical, then rationalize the denominator: ~\sqrt{\dfrac{27x}{20}}
